Circular

Piratini, October 5, 1838.

The authorities mentioned in Article 47 of the Regulation of the State Collectories, ordered to be enforced by Decree of August 14 last, the Government determines that from now on all hides exported without a guide from the owners of the brands, in which they declare their sale to the exporter, or from the Commanders of Army forces and Chiefs of Police of the Republic, with signature, and those of the Commanders of Brigades or Divisions, if they come from consumption, shall be seized, confiscated, and sold at public auction to whoever bids the highest at the Collectory of the District where the said seizure occurs.

The proceeds from the seized hides thus disposed of shall be divided into two equal parts, one for the seizer or seizors, which shall be immediately delivered, and the other for the National Treasury, as provided in Article 42 of the aforementioned regulation; which shall be complied with.
